form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Durbin (for himself, Mr. Welch, and Mr. Schiff) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations

form.official-title: To terminate authorizations for the use of military force and declarations of war no later than 10 years after the enactment of such authorizations or declarations.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Accountability for Endless Wars Act of 2025.

section.header: Termination of authorizations for the use of military force and declarations of war

subsection.header: Future authorizations for the use of military force and declarations of war
subsection.text: Any authorization for the use of military force or declaration of war enacted into law after the date of the enactment of this Act shall terminate on the date that is 10 years after the date of the enactment of such authorization or declaration.

subsection.header: Existing authorizations for the use of military force and declarations of war
subsection.text: Any authorization for the use of military force or declaration of war enacted before the date of the enactment of this Act shall terminate on the date that is 6 months after the date of such enactment.
